intro: Matelea purpusii, commonly known as the Mexican moonflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night and emit a fragrant scent to attract pollinators. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and slightly hairy, while its stems are woody and branched. Matelea purpusii is often cultivated for its nocturnal blooms and unique aesthetic appeal.
